title: Stopping Traffic in Hong Kong
description: In the first volume of the Traffick Stopping series, Mei struggles to adjust to life in Hong Kong without her sister.The more time she spends with her family the more she suspects that they may be involved with her sisters kidnapping. Mei finds that friendship and the pursuit of justice begins to heal her wounds.Mei's family attempts to end her relationship with Kai in hopes that she will find some one more affluent while at college, and discourages her from continuing to work with the police.UNICEF estimates that 1.2 million people are victims of human trafficking each year. One half of all profits from this book will be donated to UNICEF. For more information or to donate please visit www.unicef.org.
author: Chase D. Bailey
